name: horizon
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 the line at the farthest place that you can see, where the sky seems to touch the land or sea: The moon rose slowly above the horizon.on the horizon We could see a row of camels silhouetted on the horizon.
More examplesFewer examplesDo you think those are rain clouds on the horizon?Here, too, the threat of unemployment has been looming on the horizon.A broad sweep of flat countryside stretched to the horizon in all directions.Doug scanned the horizon for any sign of the boat.I hoped that going to university might broaden my horizons .

the place in the distance where the earth and sky seem to meet: [ U ] We watched the horizon as the sun set.
A person’s horizons are the limit of that person’s ideas, knowledge, and experience: [ pl ] Spending her junior year abroad has broadened her horizons.
